questions.question_text: What is the most restrictive NSX-T built-in role which will allow a user to apply configuration changes on a NSX Edge?

discussion.content: There are no built-in role named "Network Engineer", "Cloud Service Administrator", or "NSX Administrator" available in NSX-T. Therefore, among the given choices, only built-in role "Network Operator" is the correct choice as the most restrictive role.

questions.question_text: What is the maximum supported ECMP paths in NSX-T 2.4 Data Center?
questions.answer_description:
A maximum of eight ECMP paths are supported.
Reference:
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-T-Data-Center/2.4/administration/GUID-443B6B0D-F179-429E-83F3-E136038332E0.html

choices.A: Reduce the size of the virtual pool.
choices.D: Place the Tier-1 Gateway in a large edge cluster and redeploy the load balancer.
choices.C: Power-off the existing load balancer and change its size.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

An administrator is trying to configure a medium load balancer in a production environment, but is getting the error message shown in the exhibit.
Which step must the administrator perform to remediate the problem?

discussion.content:
D is correct
Only 1 LB for each Edge Medium VM size
https://configmax.vmware.com/guest?vmwareproduct=NSX-T%20Data%20Center&release=NSX-T%20Data%20Center%203.0.0&categories=20-0

choices.A: join cluster <NSX-Cluster-IP> username root password <root-password> thumbprint <NSX Manager-thumbprint>
choices.B: join management-plane <nsx-manager-ip> username admin password <admin-password> thumbprint <nsx-manager-thumbprint>
choices.D: join management-cluster <NSX-Cluster-IP> username admin password <admin-password> thumbprint <NSX Manager-thumbprint>
choices.C: join policy-manager <nsx-manager-ip> username root password <root-password> thumbprint <nsx-manager-thumbprint>
